title: Authors and Citation
text: Santos-Andrade PE, Vilca-Bustamante LL (2025). ppendemic: glimpse diversity Peru's endemic plants.
code: @Manual{,   author = {Paul E. Santos Andrade and Lucely L. Vilca Bustamante},   title = {ppendemic: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants},   year = {2025},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.5106619},   url = {https://paulesantos.github.io/ppendemic/}, }

title: A Glimpse at the Diversity of Peru's Endemic Plants
text: package offers convenient access new extensive database containing list 7898 endemic plant species found Peru. comprehensive collection provides detailed botanical information, including accepted names, family, genus, species, infraspecific taxonomy, authorship, publication details, temporal information including actual nominal publication years species. construction ppendemic package built upon valuable data sourced renowned World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP) database. WCVP international collaborative programme initiated 1988 Rafaël Govaerts provides high-quality expert-reviewed taxonomic data vascular plants. highly authoritative resource updated daily, WCVP offers comprehensive information plant taxonomy occurrence worldwide, serving taxonomic backbone World Flora Online (WFO) incorporated Catalogue Life Checklist via GBIF. Leveraging data, ppendemic package aims present --date novel compilation Peru’s endemic plant species, tailored diverse ecosystems region. incorporating meticulously curated data WCVP following International Code Nomenclature algae, fungi, plants (ICN), package offers users reliable accurate resource explore, analyze, gain deeper insights rich diversity Peru’s endemic flora. latest version (V-14, dated 28-05-2025) includes enhanced temporal bibliographic information sophisticated year extraction capabilities, distinguishing actual nominal publication years improved citation accuracy. Representing significant advancement understanding Peru’s endemic plant species, ppendemic package update previously known list 5,507 species presented Red Book Endemic Plants Peru, bringing total impressive 7898 species. substantial increase documented endemic species testament continuous integration updated taxonomic data commitment presenting current information available. expanded current database, researchers, conservationists, nature enthusiasts alike can now delve comprehensive accurate account Peru’s unique diverse plant biodiversity. database spans total 165 families, particular richness observed Orchidaceae, Asteraceae, Piperaceae, Fabaceae, Solanaceae, Bromeliaceae, Melastomataceae, Cactaceae, Araceae, Rubiaceae families, boast highest number endemic species Peru. enhanced dataset now includes 160 records actual nominal publication years differ, providing valuable insights historical botanical publishing practices.

title: A Glimpse at the Diversity of Peru's Endemic Plants
text: can install ppendemic package CRAN using: Also can install ppendemic package GitHub using following command:

title: A Glimpse at the Diversity of Peru's Endemic Plants
text: installing ppendemic package, can load R session using: Use is_ppendemic() check taxa endemic is_ppendemic() function designed work seamlessly tibbles, allowing users easily analyze determine endemic status species within tabular format.
code: library(ppendemic) #> This is ppendemic 0.1.9 splist <- c("Aa aurantiaca",               "Aa aurantiaaia",              "Werneria nubigena",               "Dasyphyllum brasiliense var. barnadesioides",              "Miconia firma",              "Festuca densiflora") is_ppendemic(splist) #> [1] "Endemic"     "Endemic"     "Not endemic" "Endemic"     "Endemic"     #> [6] "Endemic" tibble::tibble(splist = splist) |>    dplyr::mutate(endemic = is_ppendemic(splist)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   splist                                      endemic     #>   <chr>                                       <chr>       #> 1 Aa aurantiaca                               Endemic     #> 2 Aa aurantiaaia                              Endemic     #> 3 Werneria nubigena                           Not endemic #> 4 Dasyphyllum brasiliense var. barnadesioides Endemic     #> 5 Miconia firma                               Endemic     #> 6 Festuca densiflora                          Endemic

title: A Glimpse at the Diversity of Peru's Endemic Plants

code: citation("ppendemic") #> To cite ppendemic in publications use: #>  #>   Santos-Andrade PE, Vilca-Bustamante LL (2025). ppendemic: A glimpse #>   at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     author = {Paul E. Santos Andrade and Lucely L. Vilca Bustamante}, #>     title = {ppendemic: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants}, #>     year = {2025}, #>     doi = {10.5281/zenodo.5106619}, #>     url = {https://paulesantos.github.io/ppendemic/}, #>   }

text: Returns tibble matched names Matched.Genus, Matched.Species binomial names, Matched.Infraspecies valid infra species names.

title: Match Species Names to Endemic Plant List of Peru — matching_ppendemic
text: function first attempts directly match species names exact matches database (genus specific epithet, genus, specific epithet, infra species). exact match found, function performs fuzzy match using fuzzyjoin package optimal string alignment distance one, implemented stringdist. maximum edit distance intentionally set one. function matching_ppendemic returns tibble new columns Matched.Genus, Matched.Species, Matched.Infraspecies, containing matched names NA match found. Additionally, logical column added function called, allowing users see functions applied name matching process. process column shows NA, corresponding function called name already matched preceding function.

what: ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
title: ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
text: ppendemic_tab14 dataset tibble (data frame) provides easy access comprehensive database Peru's endemic plant species. contains total 7,898 records essential botanical information, including accepted name, accepted family, genus, species, infraspecific information, taxon authors, primary author, place publication, volume page, publication years, version details.

title: ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
text: tibble (data frame) 7,898 rows 18 columns: taxon_name Character vector. accepted name endemic plant species. taxon_status Character vector. taxonomic status species (e.g., "Accepted"). family Character vector. family accepted name endemic plant species. genus Character vector. genus endemic plant species. species Character vector. specific epithet endemic plant species. infraspecific_rank Character vector. infraspecific rank (e.g., "subsp.", "var.") applicable. infraspecies Character vector. infraspecific epithet applicable. taxon_authors Character vector. author(s) accepted name endemic plant species. primary_author Character vector. primary author(s) publication containing endemic plant species information. place_of_publication Character vector. place publication endemic plant species information. volume_and_page Character vector. volume page number publication containing endemic plant species information. first_published Character vector. first published year publication containing endemic plant species information. year_actual Numeric vector. actual year publication extracted first_published. year_nominal Numeric vector. nominal year publication extracted first_published. both_years Character vector. actual nominal years different, extracted first_published. has_different_years Logical vector. Indicates whether actual nominal publication years differ (TRUE both_years contains pattern "YYYY|YYYY"). version Character vector. version identifier "V-14" ppendemic database. version_date Character vector. version date "28-05-2025" indicating version created.

title: ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
text: dataset carefully compiled updated offer latest insights Peru's endemic plant species. data sourced World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP) database, international collaborative programme initiated 1988 Rafaël Govaerts provides high-quality expert-reviewed taxonomic data vascular plants. detailed methodology, see Govaerts et al. (2021) "World Checklist Vascular Plants, continuously updated resource exploring global plant diversity" Nature Scientific Data.

title: ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
text: dataset provides curated --date collection Peru's endemic plant species, gathered reputable botanical sources publications. data database extracted compiled World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP) database, comprehensive reliable repository botanical information. version (ppendemic_tab14) includes enhanced temporal information separate numeric fields actual nominal publication years. allows precise bibliographic tracking citation accuracy. dataset also includes improved infraspecific taxonomy handling dedicated fields ranks epithets. year extraction process uses sophisticated pattern matching distinguish actual publication years nominal years, has_different_years field automatically flagging records differ. particularly important historical botanical publications publication delays common.

title: ppendemic_tab14: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab14
code: # Load the package library(ppendemic)  # Access the dataset data("ppendemic_tab14")  # View the structure of the dataset str(ppendemic_tab14) #> tibble [7,898 × 18] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ taxon_name          : chr [1:7898] "Pappobolus verbesinoides" "Maxillaria briggittheae" "Pappobolus lanatus" "Maxillaria beckendorfii" ... #>  $ taxon_status        : chr [1:7898] "Accepted" "Accepted" "Accepted" "Accepted" ... #>  $ family              : chr [1:7898] "Asteraceae" "Orchidaceae" "Asteraceae" "Orchidaceae" ... #>  $ Genus               : chr [1:7898] "Pappobolus" "Maxillaria" "Pappobolus" "Maxillaria" ... #>  $ Species             : chr [1:7898] "verbesinoides" "briggittheae" "lanatus" "beckendorfii" ... #>  $ infraspecific_rank  : chr [1:7898] NA NA NA NA ... #>  $ infraspecies        : chr [1:7898] NA NA NA NA ... #>  $ taxon_authors       : chr [1:7898] "(Kunth) Panero" "Molinari" "(Heiser) Panero" "(Carnevali) Molinari" ... #>  $ primary_author      : chr [1:7898] "Panero" "Molinari" "Panero" "Molinari" ... #>  $ place_of_publication: chr [1:7898] "Syst. Bot. Monogr." "Richardiana" "Syst. Bot. Monogr." "Richardiana" ... #>  $ volume_and_page     : chr [1:7898] " 36: 75" " 15: 302" " 36: 164" " 15: 294" ... #>  $ first_published     : chr [1:7898] "(1992)" "(2015)" "(1992)" "(2015)" ... #>  $ year_actual         : num [1:7898] 1992 2015 1992 2015 2002 ... #>  $ year_nominal        : num [1:7898] 1992 2015 1992 2015 2002 ... #>  $ both_years          : chr [1:7898] "1992" "2015" "1992" "2015" ... #>  $ has_different_years : logi [1:7898] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE NA ... #>  $ version             : chr [1:7898] "V-14" "V-14" "V-14" "V-14" ... #>  $ version_date        : chr [1:7898] "28-05-2025" "28-05-2025" "28-05-2025" "28-05-2025" ...  # View first few rows head(ppendemic_tab14) #> # A tibble: 6 × 18 #>   taxon_name   taxon_status family Genus Species infraspecific_rank infraspecies #>   <chr>        <chr>        <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>              <chr>        #> 1 Pappobolus … Accepted     Aster… Papp… verbes… NA                 NA           #> 2 Maxillaria … Accepted     Orchi… Maxi… briggi… NA                 NA           #> 3 Pappobolus … Accepted     Aster… Papp… lanatus NA                 NA           #> 4 Maxillaria … Accepted     Orchi… Maxi… becken… NA                 NA           #> 5 Oreocereus … Accepted     Cacta… Oreo… doelzi… subsp.             calvus       #> 6 Hyptis salv… Accepted     Lamia… Hypt… salvio… NA                 NA           #> # ℹ 11 more variables: taxon_authors <chr>, primary_author <chr>, #> #   place_of_publication <chr>, volume_and_page <chr>, first_published <chr>, #> #   year_actual <dbl>, year_nominal <dbl>, both_years <chr>, #> #   has_different_years <lgl>, version <chr>, version_date <chr>  # Check for species with different actual and nominal years different_years <- subset(ppendemic_tab14, has_different_years == TRUE) nrow(different_years) #> [1] 160  # View records with both years information head(ppendemic_tab14$both_years[ppendemic_tab14$has_different_years]) #> [1] NA          "1997|1998" "2001|2002" "2002|2003" "1938|1937" "2013|2014"
